p:
For example, in the Murray–Darling Basin in southeastern Australia, the autocorrelation of the annual P time series (1901–2007) is statistically indistinguishable from zero for lags from 1 to 30 y ( 23). That result shows that the 106-y record of annual rainfall for the Murray–Darling Basin is indistinguishable from a random process. In a physical sense, it means that there is no memory ( 17) of P from one year to the next. Given the seemingly random nature of annual P time series ( 24
– 27), we anticipated that the Murray–Darling Basin results might be typical of many regions worldwide.
